name: Amazon
hint: The largest river by discharge in the world, flowing through Peru and Brazil to the Atlantic Ocean

name: Parana
hint: South America's second-longest river, flowing through Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina to the Rio de la Plata

name: Orinoco
hint: One of South America's longest rivers, forming a vast delta in Venezuela on the Atlantic coast

name: Sao Francisco
hint: The longest river entirely within Brazil, flowing through the semi-arid northeast to the Atlantic

name: Madeira
hint: The largest tributary of the Amazon by volume, flowing from Bolivia through western Brazil

name: Tocantins
hint: A major river in central-eastern Brazil, flowing north into the Amazon estuary near Belem

name: Paraguay
hint: A major river flowing through Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina, a principal tributary of the Parana

name: Uruguay
hint: A river flowing south from Brazil, forming the border between Argentina and Uruguay

name: Magdalena
hint: Colombia's principal river, flowing northward between the Andes ranges to the Caribbean Sea

name: Negro
hint: The largest left tributary of the Amazon, famous for its dark-colored water that meets the Solimoes near Manaus
